end.title: Doctor Sleep
end.creator_credit: Trevor Macy, Jon Berg and Terry Anderson

video_links.name: Doctor Sleep - Final Trailer - Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: Still irrevocably scarred by the trauma he endured as a child at the Overlook, Dan Torrance has fought to find some semblance of peace. But that peace is shattered when he encounters Abra, a courageous teenager with her own powerful extrasensory gift, known as the ‘shine’. Instinctively recognising that Dan shares her power, Abra has sought him out, desperate for his help against the merciless Rose the Hat and her followers.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

links.description: Not only is Doctor Sleep a sequel to Kubrick’s film, both feature curious miniatures that echo the main character’s emotional state. The hedge maze model in The Shining, symbolising the twisted mind, and the town replica in Doctor Sleep, symbolising Dan’s attachment to his childhood.

links.description: Aside from the influential dystopian setting, Blade Runner is lauded for its striking visual effects, particularly the ‘spinners’ – hi-tech cars that soar through the streets and the sky. Spinner models were filmed against a black screen and then superimposed on the model shots of LA.
